title: Time Mastery Theory v2.4: 100% SPARC Validation for Dark Matter and Dark Energy
description: The Time Mastery Theory (TMT) v2.4 proposes that dark matter (25%) and dark energy (70%) emerge from temporons - time particles with infinite range. The theory is based on temporal superposition: |Ψ⟩ = α|t⟩ + β|t̄⟩, where matter exists in a quantum superposition of forward and backward time states. Key v2.4 innovations: (1) r_c(M,Σ) formula with surface brightness correction for LSB galaxies, (2) Baryonic threshold accepting k=0 when Newton fits well, (3) Dual-beta model (β_SNIa=0.001, β_H0=0.82). Results: 100% SPARC validation (156/156 galaxies), 81.2% Chi² reduction vs Newton, 8/8 cosmological tests passed. Combined statistical significance: p = 10⁻¹¹² (>15σ). H₀ tension 100% resolved.
notes: TMT v2.4 achieves 100% SPARC validation with key improvements: (1) r_c(M,Σ) = 2.6×(M/10¹⁰)^0.56×(Σ/100)^-0.3 with surface brightness correction, (2) Baryonic threshold: accept k=0 when χ²_Newton/χ²_TMT < 1.1, (3) Dual-beta model for expansion (β_SNIa=0.001, β_H0=0.82). Results: SPARC 156/156 (100%), Chi² reduction 81.2%, median improvement 97.0%. Score: 8/8 cosmological tests. Statistics: p = 1.36 × 10⁻¹¹² (>15σ). Total galaxies analyzed: 2.4 million.
references: Lelli, McGaugh & Schombert (2016). SPARC: Mass models for 175 disk galaxies. AJ, 152, 157.
Laigle et al. (2016). The COSMOS2015 Catalog. ApJS, 224, 24.
Hildebrandt et al. (2017). KiDS-450: Cosmological parameter constraints. MNRAS, 465, 1454.
Scolnic et al. (2022). The Pantheon+ Analysis. ApJ, 938, 113.
Riess et al. (2022). A Comprehensive Measurement of H0. ApJ, 934, L7.
Planck Collaboration (2020). Planck 2018 results. VI. Cosmological parameters. A&A, 641, A6.
Di Valentino et al. (2021). In the realm of the Hubble tension. Class. Quantum Grav. 38, 153001.
